name: imponderably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that cannot be guessed or calculated because of being completely unknown: To the young boy, his father was far off, working in an imponderably distant place. The two musicians gave impressive performances of the imponderably difficult works.
More examplesFewer examplesIn her latest film, she plays an imponderably dull police scientist.All of this depends on imponderably complex mathematical formulas.Human diseases have caused imponderably large social changes over the centuries.The mind-body problem strikes us as imponderably deep.
